title: President of Pakistan
summary: The president of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan (Urdu: صدر مملکت اسلامی جمہوریہ پاکستان‎, romanized: S̤adr-i Mamlukat Islāmī Jumhūrīya-i Pākistān), is the ceremonial head of state of Pakistan and the commander-in-chief of Pakistan Armed Forces.[3][4] The post was created when Pakistan became a republic on 23 March 1956. Until 1956, Pakistan was a dominion within the Commonwealth of Nations with Queen Elizabeth II as the head of state and queen of Pakistan.
